文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk1
证据片段: Pressure tubes that form the primary pressure boundary in CANDU reactors are made of cold worked Zr-2.5Nb autoclaved in steam at 400°C to produce a black adherent oxide film of ~1 to 2 μm in thickness.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk1
证据片段: Trace elements in Zr-2.5Nb pressure tube material are generally low (<50 ppm) with the exception of iron (<500 ppm w/w) and (~1000 ppm w/w).

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk1
证据片段: Average deuterium uptake rates in Ontario Hydro's pressure tubes are generally low (<1 ppm by weight/annum)

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk1
证据片段: On pressure tube inside surfaces, which are in contact with lithiated heavy water (D₂O) coolant at 250 to 300°C

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk1
证据片段: On pressure tube inside surfaces, which are in contact with lithiated heavy water (D₂O) coolant at 250 to 300°C

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk1
证据片段: Average uniform oxide thicknesses on pressure tube inside surfaces have not exceeded ~20 μm after 4350 effective full power days (EFPD).

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk1
证据片段: The oxides on the outer surfaces of the pressure tubes are in contact with a generally dry (typically -20 to -50°C dew point) annulus gas consisting of nitrogen (N₂) or carbon dioxide (CO₂) with <25 ppm oxygen (O₂) and up to 1 vol% deuterium, at approximately atmospheric pressure.
气氛: dry (dew point -20 to -50°C); nitrogen (N₂) or carbon dioxide (CO₂); <25 ppm oxygen (O₂); up to 1 vol% deuterium

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk1
证据片段: Thin rectangular specimens were cut from the inside and outside surfaces of irradiated pressure tubes at selected axial locations corresponding to different average rates of hydrogen ingress and local reactor environments, following 2800 to 4350 EFPD exposure in-reactor.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk2
证据片段: Specimens exposed out-of-reactor to controlled deuterium gas environment were also taken from coupons of $\mathsf { Z r } { \mathsf { - } } 2 . 5 \mathsf { N b }$ pressure tube material and high purity $( 9 9 . 9 9 \% )$ crystal bar zirconium following aqueous/steam oxidation in autoclaves at temperatures of 300 to $4 0 0 \mathrm { { \circ } C }$ .

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk2
证据片段: Selected specimens were then exposed to vacuum $\mathit { \Omega } \cdot \mathit { 1 0 ^ { - 8 } }$ torr $[ 1 . 3 \times 1 0 ^ { - 6 } \mathrm { P a } ] ,$ at temperatures of 400 to $5 0 0 \mathrm { { } ^ { \circ } C }$ in order to investigate possible changes occurring in the oxide in a simulated reducing reactor annulus gas environment.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk2
证据片段: This tube had low bulk alloy deuterium concentrations along its length $( < 1 0 ~ \mathrm { p p m ~ w / w ~ D } )$ , following 2800 EFPD exposure to a $\mathrm { C O } _ { 2 }$ annulus gas.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk2
证据片段: Higher deuterium contents are found in the oxides of specimens taken from the hotter 6 o'clock location compared to specimens removed from the 12 o'clock position.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk3
证据片段: The oxide/metal interface formed in steam at $4 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ after $2 4 \ \mathrm { h }$

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk4
证据片段: Amorphous material, generally ~10 nm thick, was also observed both at the metal/oxide interface and at columnar grain boundaries throughout the oxide.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk4
证据片段: Dark field TEM micrograph of a typical region of the oxide formed on Zr-2.5Nb during out-reactor corrosion showing amorphous material at the columnar oxide grain boundaries

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk4
证据片段: Thin oxides formed in steam at 400°C on Zr-2.5Nb act as excellent hydrogen permeation barriers following up to 4350 EFPD exposure

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk4
证据片段: Diffusivity of deuterium into the oxide inferred from these profiles (~10^-22 m²/s at 300°C)

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk4
证据片段: values obtained from out-reactor experiments (~10^-21 m²/s at 300°C)

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk4
证据片段: in-reactor exposures do not reduce (and may improve) the barrier properties of the oxide film

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_045_chunk4
证据片段: inferred values of diffusion coefficient were ~20 times higher than in specimens that were not vacuum annealed
